description: Dozens of Iraqi villages that were under the control of the Islamic State suffered from looting and extensive property destruction after being retaken by pro-government forces, a study says.
title: After ISIS Retreats in Iraq, Evidence of Shiite Retaliation
title_page: After ISIS Retreats in Iraq, Evidence of Shiite Retaliation - The New York Times
text:
Hufriyya
Hundreds of buildings were demolished or set on fire in villages near the town of Amerli, after the area fell back into government hands last fall, according to the study by Human Rights Watch. The village of Hufriyya was devastated, with entire blocks wiped out.
